item.title: Plastic pollution: Could recycling PPE reduce the problem?
item.description: It is estimated 19 billion single-use face masks have been used in the UK this year.

item.title: Wales basks in September sun - but will it last?
item.description: It may officially be autumn - but Wales will bask in sunshine as temperatures soar on Tuesday.

item.title: Army's Ajax vehicle noise prompts 310 soldier hearing tests
item.description: Trials of the Ajax armoured vehicle have been halted twice after complaints about noise.

item.title: Man due in court charged with Barry grandfather's murder
item.description: A 53-year-old will appear in court accused of murdering Robert Farley, 61, at his south Wales home.

item.title: Cyclist airlifted to hospital after Bike Park Wales incident
item.description: The man was hurt after an incident at a mountain biking circuit in south Wales.

item.title: Perpetuus: Security review ordered into takeover of graphene firm
item.description: The UK's business secretary intervenes in a takeover of Perpetuus over security concerns.

item.title: City Road: Suspected ammonia attack injures five in Cardiff
item.description: Police say the people involved in the attack are known to each other.

item.title: Borth fire: Neighbour alerted grandchild to house fire
item.description: A neighbour says three generations of the same family were in the house when the flames took hold.

item.title: Fostering: Referrals up as mother urges people to sign up
item.description: Bridget Davies says the children she has fostered "have been awesome".

item.title: Covid: Visits by carer with suspected coronavirus 'gobsmacking'
item.description: Samantha Gould carried out home visits after being told to self-isolate, a tribunal hears.

item.title: Church in Wales to give blessings for same-sex marriages
item.description: The church votes to allow blessings, but will still not marry same-sex couples.

item.title: Recycling: How do you transform old PPE into something new?
item.description: Turning millions of disposable masks and medical waste into new items is one firm's new mission.

item.title: Wheelchair Moto Cross: Teen's push for Paralympic recognition
item.description: Lily Rice is already a world champion - and now wants to see her sport given a Paralympic stage

item.title: Firefighters tackle large Blaenavon recycling plant blaze
item.description: Residents living nearby have been advised to keep windows and doors closed due to smoke.

item.title: Covid, Brexit and driver shortage blamed for bin collection delays
item.description: Some residents are complaining that rubbish has been left on their streets for weeks.

item.title: Borth fire: Flames and black smoke billow from blaze
item.description: The fire broke out in a three-storey property with 30 firefighters trying to stop it spreading.

item.title: Tokyo Olympians welcomed home to Ystrad Mynach and Blackwood
item.description: Boxing gold medallist Lauren Price said it was "amazing" to give back to their home towns.

item.title: Wales: FAW confirms fans can travel to October away qualifiers
item.description: The Football Association of Wales has confirmed Wales fans will be allowed to travel to October's World Cup Qualifiers in Czech Republic and Estonia.

item.title: Wales add Tottenham's Joe Rodon to squad for Estonia but Aaron Ramsey ruled out
item.description: Wales add centre-back Joe Rodon to their squad for Wednesday's World Cup qualifier against Estonia, but Aaron Ramsey will not feature.

item.title: Gareth Bale summons spirit of Andorra and Euro 2016 to save Wales against Belarus
item.description: Gareth Bale summons the spirit of Andorra and Euro 2016 to save Wales once again against Belarus.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Aled Sion Davies has sights set on Paris 2024
item.description: Wales' triple Paralympic champion Aled Sion Davies will be aiming for further success at Paris 2024.

item.title: Gerwyn Price: World number one wins Hungarian Darts Trophy
item.description: Wales' Gerwyn Price wins his fourth PDC European Tour title with victory in the inaugural Hungarian Darts Trophy.

item.title: Ceredigion: Pryder am gwtogi gwasanaeth ambiwlans
item.description: Pennaeth y gwasanaeth yn gwadu cynlluniau wedi i'r AS lleol fynegi pryderon am doriadau.

item.title: Cwmni'n toddi hen offer PPE i greu masgiau newydd
item.description: Cwmni o Gaerdydd yn rhan o broses "arloesol" all osgoi llosgi neu dirlenwi biliynau o hen fasgiau tafladwy.

item.title: Cyhuddo dyn o lofruddio dyn 61 oed yn Y Barri
item.description: Bydd Lee John Whitlock yn mynd o flaen ynadon wedi ei gyhuddo o lofruddio Robert Farley.

item.title: Oes angen cadw beichiogrwydd cynnar yn gyfrinach?
item.description: Esyllt Sears yn trafod cyhoeddi beichiogrwydd cyn deuddeg wythnos.

item.title: Rodon yn ôl ond Ramsey dal allan yn erbyn Estonia
item.description: Yr amddiffynwr yn ôl yn y garfan ar gyfer gêm ragbrofol Cwpan y Byd ond Aaron Ramsey yn dal ag anaf.
